context.introduction: Master the basics of masa and tortilla making! Learn how to create authentic Mexican tortillas from scratch.

sections.title: Corn Masa: The Foundation
sections.content: Traditional tortillas are made from corn masa, which is soft, moist, and easy to shape. Masa is the base for many Mexican dishes.

sections.title: Tortilla Consistency
sections.content: The perfect masa should be soft but not sticky. Add water little by little until the dough is smooth and holds together.

sections.title: Cooking Tortillas
sections.content: Fresh tortillas are cooked on a hot comal without oil. They should puff slightly and have light brown spots when ready.

sections.title: Tips for Perfect Tortillas
listItems: Use fresh masa for best results
Press tortillas evenly for uniform thickness
Cook on a hot, dry surface
Do not add oil to the comal
